newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Konka to make 3 for 10 rights offer.
newsitem.headline: Konka to make 3 for 10 rights offer.

text.p: Shenzhen Konka Electronic Group Co Ltd said it is due to make a three-for-10 rights offer to B shareholders following the completion of a rights issue to holders of A shares and legal person shares in July.
The offer to its B shareholders has been priced at HK$5.85 per rights share, Konka said in a prospectus published in the Shenzhen-based Securities Times.
On Friday, Konka's B shares closed at HK$6.80 per share.
The deadline to register for the offer has been set at October 29 and Konka's B shares will go ex-rights the following day, the prospectus said.
China Southern Securities has been appointed the chief domestic underwriter for the rights offer, with W.I. Carr Indosuez Capital Asia Ltd the international coordinator, Konka said.
Konka said it expected the B rights offer to be fully taken up and to raise about 218 million yuan in net proceeds.
The colour television maker said it plans to use the proceeds to expand its core operations and supplement working capital.

Konka currently has total share capital of 330.11 million shares, including 213.56 million founder shares, 79.28 million A shares, 37.18 million B shares and 86,266 staff shares, according to the prospectus.

A spokesman for Konka told the Hong Kong-based newsletter China Securities Bulletin that Konka's rights offer to A shareholders was successful and Konka had racked up net proceeds of 329.5 million yuan.
Proceeds from the B rights offer will be mostly channeled into the same projects being financed by its A rights proceeds, the spokesman said.
He said those included the ongoing construction of a 210,000-sq-metre electronics product production complex in the city of Dongguan in Guangdong province.
Some proceeds would also be used to expand the sales of its televisions abroad by setting up outlets in Hong Kong and Russia, the official added.
